sn51.33-44:4.1: “Mendicants, the Ganges river slants, slopes, and inclines to the east.
sn51.33-44:4.2: In the same way, a mendicant who develops the four bases of psychic power slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.
sn51.33-44:4.3: And how does a mendicant who develops the four bases of psychic power slant, slope, and incline to extinguishment?
sn51.33-44:4.4: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to enthusiasm … energy …
sn51.33-44:5.1: In the same way, a mendicant who develops the four bases of psychic power slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.”
sn51.33-44:8.1: Six on slanting to the east,
sn51.33-44:8.2: and six on slanting to the ocean;
sn51.33-44:8.4: and that’s how this chapter is recited.
